intro: Hieracium subterscissiforme, commonly known as the subterranean hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically has hairy stems and leaves that are lance-shaped with a rough texture. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster, often blooming in late summer. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and threatened species in many areas.
